title: L.A. schools have a plan to reverse enrollment woes: Recruit newborn babies
dc:creator: Howard Blume
description: L.A. Unified School District will reach out to parents of newborns to connect them with services in hopes of eventually offsetting rapidly declining enrollment.
content:encoded: L.A. Unified School District will reach out to parents of newborns to connect them with services in hopes of eventually offsetting rapidly declining enrollment.

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CA - NOVEMBER 1, 2022: Los Angeles Unified Superintendent Alberto M. Carvalho announces a partnership with LAC+USC Medical Center to support new families with educational resources and engagement opportunities with District schools on November 1, 2022 in Los Angeles, California. The program called Born to Learn is intend to help families navigate early childhood development.(Gina Ferazzi / Los Angeles Times)
